file_content.text: We must make the Hutts see reason. The Empire can't keep hiding behind their neutrality.
We've long had a slice into the intercom system at Camp 27. I heard everything.
Ako Domi is still called "savior" by so many people, but he had so much evil inside him....
I'm glad he's dead. Now no one needs to learn about his fall. He can be remembered as we wish he had been.
Young Jedi need their heroes.
That is for the best.
Agreed. We need to maintain their faith in a time like this.
People need heroes. Especially now.
That's for the best.
They can't know they owe their lives to a Sith.
Makes you wonder if any of the people we call heroes actually are.
I guess....
Ako Domi was a true hero once. What happened here doesn't undo that.
Let him stand as a warning about what we face when fighting the Empire.
No. The truth must be known.
True. Many in the Republic don't realize what's at stake if the Empire wins. Maybe they should learn.
Perhaps the Jedi Council can still find something left of who he used to be.
It's his choice whether to turn his back on the dark side and embrace the light.
They will do what they can.
From what I heard, his mind seems pretty made up.
It didn't look too likely from where I was standing.
I don't know.
I hear you.
It's giving him that chance that makes us better than the Empire.
We had to try.
Where they offer their prisoners torture, we should offer ours balm. Eventually, their people may see which is better.
I tried to save him.
No one blames you. Without you, we would have lost far more Republic soldiers to Camp 27.
Thank you for shutting down that factory of horrors. There are free men of the Republic who will bless your names each night.
We will turn this place, I swear it. Nar Shaddaa must join the Republic, so the Empire can never hide such monstrosities again!
Head to Camp 27. I'll contact you there.
I've got the codes.
All right. Let me just scan them.
If this doesn't work, at least our techs have somewhere to start the next time.
By the end of today, Camp 27 will be a memory.
It will work.
Then it's one I'll do my best to forget.
What do you mean, "doesn't work?"
Next time?
I won't lie. This is dangerous -- no one's ever come out of Camp 27 alive. But I can't think of anyone who'd have a better shot.
Are you done yet?
There.
The codes will only be good for a little bit longer. Hurry and use them to get inside, then access the security console and let me know you're in.
If you can pull this off, you'll be rescuing a true hero of the Republic.
Hurry. You need to get in before the codes change!
Keep your voice low. These buildings are abandoned, but Imperial probe droids do sweeps periodically.
Zan Loren, Republic intelligence. Thanks for checking in. I heard you've made yourself a hero to some of the alien refugees around here.
Zan Loren, Republic intelligence. Thanks for coming by. Lieutenant Rale sent word about how you rescued him, said you might want to help out here.
Zan Loren, Republic intelligence. Good to meet you. Ambassador Averdon sent a bulletin about your work with the Kintan Kings. Said you're a true friend to the Republic.
Zan Loren, Republic intelligence. I heard your list of good deeds is growing. I hope you're here to add another.
Care to try your hand at a prison break?
Care to give a few more details before I commit?
I'll need more than that.
Wise choice. Group like yours gotta conserve its resources, right?
I knew you Jedi are known for your wisdom.
Good choice. Ever consider throwing over the service for the SIS?
No one makes a blind promise on the street, huh?
I'm up for anything.
Before you agree, just let me give you the down and dirty.
If they throw someone into a place like this, there's a reason.
Are you out of your mind?
For sure. Believe me, the Hutts don't warehouse people who can't serve them anymore.
This is about the Empire, and the atrocities they hide behind Nar Shaddaa's neutrality.
This is Shadow Town, a prison city filled with the Empire's worst assassins and madmen, kept on ice 'til Papa Sith needs them.
Why would we release Imperial prisoners?
And you want to free them?
And?
It's not just Imperials who wash up here.
Nar Shaddaa just gets more charming the longer I stay here.
That's awful.
Tell me about it. I've been stationed here six years. That's why I want to help these guys out.
The Empire holds prisoners of war, our men, in the worst of this whole mess--Camp 27.
We know they're holding Ako Domi here, one of the Jedi heroes of the Battle of Sullust, and we want him back.
I would not wish any Jedi's spirit exposed to such a place.
I'll do it.
They say Ako Domi was one of the best young Jedi in years. Close to yourself, even.
When we send our men into battle, it's with the assurance that we'll come for them if they end up in a place like this.
I'm in.
Absolutely. These are the guys who put their lives on the line.
I've seen my share of prisons, but this one sounds like a doozy.
I'll give it a go.
I wouldn't wish my worst enemy to end up here.
Sounds like a worthy goal. Now what are the odds?
What are our chances?
In a word? Bad.
The security in Camp 27 is tighter than I've ever seen. Their access codes are in parts, split among teams of guards so no one enters alone.
Every few minutes, they swap out the entire code.
What's our first move?
I'll kick in the front door, and we go from there.
So forget the codes.
I think that's beyond even your capabilities.
We're on Nar Shaddaa, right? No one does anything for free.
What do I get out of it?
Guess you don't watch "Rescue Rewards" on holovid... each of these POWs carries a hefty reward from the Republic government.
You'll need to find the camp wardens when they're outside the shields, get the codes from them.
The whole thing, mind. No one man's got more than one part.
Once I've got them, you want them here, or am I heading in?
Then what?
Come back. I need to get an imprint of the codes... in case you don't make it out again.
These Imperial torturers will taste real pain.
I'll take them down.
Just don't drag it out. You need to bring those codes back to me, so I can get an imprint... in case you don't make it out again.
Good luck, and go quickly. If the codes change before you're in, we're lost.
Never mind. [Refuse quest]
Not my thing. [Refuse quest]
It's a challenge, no doubt. I just thought folks like you might be up for it.
It's a challenge, no doubt. I just got the impression you might be up for it.
Keep your head down. The Empire doesn't welcome outsiders here.
